news_header: Elon Musk and Sam Altman, once partners at Open AI, are now at odds over a $97.4 billion bid Musk made for the company.
news_original_title: Elon Musk teki lähes sadan miljardin dollarin tarjouksen Open AI:sta – sai pilkallisen vastauksen
news_text: Elon Musk and Sam Altman, former partners in the artificial intelligence company Open AI, have become adversaries. Musk has made a $97.4 billion bid for the non-profit segment of Open AI, which is currently led by Altman. The offer is seen as a potential valuation for the non-profit, as the board is restructuring to separate profit-making activities. Musk has criticized Open AI for straying from its charitable roots and has filed complaints against the company. Altman responded mockingly to Musk's offer, suggesting they could buy Twitter for a fraction of the bid. Musk's financial position may require him to sell shares in Tesla or SpaceX to fund the offer.
